meanings.definition: Not involving or requiring critical judgment or evaluation.
meanings.sent1: The noncritical task was easy to complete without needing to think too hard.
meanings.sent2: She made a noncritical decision about what to wear to the party.
meanings.sent3: The noncritical choice of ice cream flavor led to a fun taste test.
meanings.sent4: His noncritical approach to problem-solving allowed him to see things from a different perspective.
meanings.sent5: The noncritical feedback from the teacher was encouraging and positive.

meanings.sent1: The noncritical ingredient could be left out of the recipe without changing the taste.
meanings.sent2: His absence was noncritical to the success of the project.
meanings.sent3: Forgetting the noncritical item on the grocery list made for an interesting dinner.
meanings.sent4: The noncritical detail in the painting added a touch of whimsy.
meanings.sent5: Her noncritical role in the play still brought joy to the audience.

meanings.sent1: The patient was noncritical and expected to make a full recovery.
meanings.sent2: The car was noncritical after the minor fender bender.
meanings.sent3: The noncritical injury allowed him to still participate in the game.
meanings.sent4: The noncritical damage to the building was quickly repaired.
meanings.sent5: The noncritical issue with the computer was easily fixed.
